node.title: Kristen Stewart and Kirsten Dunst could receive their first Oscar nominations.
node.alt: Kristen Stewart, left, in “Spencer” and Kirsten Dunst in “The Power of the Dog.”
node.description: By Brooks Barnes and Nicole Sperling
node.content: ["This year\u2019s best actress race is unusually competitive, with a wide variety of performances getting noticed by critics\u2019 groups and other awards organizations. Nicole Kidman (\u201cBeing the Ricardos\u201d), Olivia Colman (\u201cThe Lost Daughter\u201d) and Lady Gaga (\u201cHouse of Gucci\u201d) are widely expected to receive nominations. But there are at least six plausible contenders for the two remaining slots.", "Will voters give one to Kristen Stewart? She stretched outside her acting comfort zone to play Princess Diana in \u201cSpencer\u201d and has been a star for 20 years without any Oscar love \u2014 making her \u201cdue,\u201d as Hollywood puts it. On the other hand, Stewart was notably left off the SAG Awards nominee list on Jan. 12.", "Other possibilities include Jessica Chastain (\u201cThe Eyes of Tammy Faye\u201d), Pen\u00e9lope Cruz (\u201cParallel Mothers\u201d), Jennifer Hudson (\u201cRespect\u201d), Alana Haim (\u201cLicorice Pizza\u201d) and Renate Reinsve (\u201cThe Worst Person in the World\u201d).", "In the supporting actress category, Kirsten Dunst will almost certainly receive her first nomination for playing an alcoholic mother in \u201cThe Power of the Dog.\u201d A 32-year screen veteran, Dunst has waited even longer than Stewart for academy recognition. Caitriona Balfe (\u201cBelfast\u201d), Ariana DeBose (\u201cWest Side Story\u201d) and Aunjanue Ellis (\u201cKing Richard\u201d) may also receive their first nominations."]
